body.p: “Just below this bridge begins an otter-track “,” several days old yet very distinct “,” which I trace half a mile down the river. In the snow less than an inch deep “,” on the ice “,” each foot makes a track three inches wide “,” apparently enlarged in melting “,” and the whole four appear thus: [image] The clear interval “,” sixteen inches; the length occupied by the four feet “,” fourteen inches.”
PE 10, pg. 185 / 4 January-23 April 1856 / NNPM MA 1302:26 / T vol. # XX / PDF # XIV / JVIII
